details.title: PM Narendra Modi said the government is ready to face the Opposition
details.content:
Minutes before the commencement of the Parliament's Monsoon session, Prime Minister Narendra Modi said the government is ready to face the Opposition. 

Modi said,"We hope that MonsoonSession of Parliament functions smoothly, whatever issues any party has, it can raise on the floor of the house. Govt is ready for discussion on all issues". 

During the last budget session, out of alloted 400 hours, the Parliament spent only 127 hours. The Lok Sabha only spent 1% of its time on the legislative business. 

Modi while addressing the media also added,"I hope all the parties and cabinet ministers use the allotted time to work together in bringing the country forward".

This session, over the next 18 sessions, it is expected to take up a total 68 pending cases.

details.title: New Rajya Sabha members take oath
details.content:
Classical Dancer Sonal Mansingh, Author Rakesh Sinha and Sculptor Raghunath Mohapatra take oath as nominated members of Rajya Sabha. #MonsoonSession2018 pic.twitter.com/umbj8OiSfx

— ANI (@ANI) July 18, 2018

details.title: TDP MPs protest demanding special status to Andhra Pradesh during Monsoon session
No-confidence motion against government
details.content: Today, the Opposition parties--Congress, RJD, CPI, TDP moved a no-confidence motion against the government.

details.title: Amid protests Rajya Sabha adjourned till 12 pm
details.content:
Rajya Sabha adjourned till 12 pm after protest by TDP MPs over special status demand for Andhra Pradesh #MonsoonSession

— ANI (@ANI) July 18, 2018

details.title: Congress MP Jyotiraditya Scindia attacks the Centre, says his party is moving the motion
details.content:
Congress MP Jyotiraditya Scindia says in Lok Sabha 'The govt which led farmers to commit suicide, under whose regime women are being raped everyday...we move no confidence motion against you' #MonsoonSession

— ANI (@ANI) July 18, 2018

details.title: Opposition creates ruckus in Lok Sabha
details.content: Samajwadi Party and Telugu Desam Party MPs protest in the well of the House in Lok Sabha over different issues (mob lynching cases and demand for special status for Andhra Pradesh).

details.title: Left parties raise Farmer's distress in the Lok Sabha
details.content: CPI(M) MP Md. Salim raises farmers' issue in the Lok Sabha.

details.title: Rajya Sabha proceedings begin
details.content: After the Rajya Sabha first day session resumed from noon, the issue of declining employment rate was raised in the Parliament.

details.title: No-Confidence Motion accepted by LS Speaker
details.content: Lok Sabha speaker Sumitra Mahajan accepts the no-confidence motion moved by the Opposition against the Government.

details.title: Nominated Rajya Sabha MP, boxer MC Mary Kom arrived at Parliament
details.content:
Nominated Rajya Sabha MP, boxer MC Mary Kom arrived at Parliament earlier today for #MonsoonSession. pic.twitter.com/klyR0gF5tH

— ANI (@ANI) July 18, 2018

details.title: Minister of State for Civil Aviation Jayant Sinha responds to questions by MPs
details.content: Jayant Sinha replying to questions by MPs on hefty charges for seats being imposed by major airlines including national carrier, Air India.

details.title: Shashi Tharoor urges Narendra Modi to act against attack on the idea of India, lynching and hooliganism
details.content:
Congress MP Shashi Tharoor raises attack on his constituency office in Kerala saying that the vandalism was not against a party member but against the idea of India and its democracy. 

He urged PM Narendra Modi to break his silence on the ongoing lynchings in the country.

details.title: Union minister Rajnath Singh on exclusive special courts to look into for SC/ST related cases
details.content: To address the issue of atrocitities against SC/STs, governmement will ensure fast delivery of justic. It prposed 174 exclusive special courts to expedite justice.

details.title: BJP MP Ananth Kumar rubbishes Shashi Tharror's claims
details.content: BJP MP Ananth Kumar rubbishes Shashi Tharror's claims on the involvement of BJP in the recent attack on Tharoor's office in his constituency. He said,"Shashi Tharoor shouldn't put the blame on BJP when he knows that CPI(M) was behind the attack".

details.title: Lok Sabha Deputy Speaker M Thambi Durai condemns attack on Shashi Tharoor's office
details.content: Dr M Thambi Durai, Deputy Speaker of Lok Sabha condemned the attack on Shashi Tharoor's office and urged Parliament Minister Ananth Kumar to ensure security to Parliamentarians.

details.title: Rajya Sabha adjourned
details.content: The Rajya Sabha has been adjourned till 2 pm

details.title: Lok Sabha adjourned
details.content: The Lok Sabha has been adjourned till 2.10 pm

details.title: Discussion on No-confidence motion to take place later this week
details.content:
Discussion on No confidence motion to take place on Friday in Lok Sabha and Monday in Rajya Sabha. #MonsoonSession

— ANI (@ANI) July 18, 2018

details.title: Congress MP Shashi Tharoor says, those who vandalised his office should apologize
details.content:
#WATCH: Congress MP Shashi Tharoor says 'I will not withdraw any of my statements, instead those who attacked my office should tender an apology.' pic.twitter.com/HJ3bzEgsUF

— ANI (@ANI) July 18, 2018
Lok Sabha to take up discussion and voting on no- confidence motion on July 20: Speaker Sumitra Mahajan.
"Who says we don't have the numbers?," asks Sonia Gandhi when asked about No Confidence motion
Congress MP from Kerala KC Venugopal questions ''Institute of Eminence'' tag to Jio Institute.

We are glad that the Speaker has accepted the oppositon's No Confidence Motion. This gives us the opportunity to hold the Govt accountable and force them to break their silence on key issues.

— Congress (@INCIndia) July 18, 2018

details.title: NDA, Opposition start issuing whips to their MPs
details.content: All India Trinamool Congress (TMC) issues whip to its MPs over the No Confidence Motion. BJP has already issued a three-line whip over the matter and asked its allies to do the same.

No confidence motion is a very important aspect of Parliament. We had requested the speaker & govt to change the date. We protested but couldn't convince them. So, all MPs have been asked to come to Delhi. Whip also will be issued: Dinesh Trivedi, TMC pic.twitter.com/I66XPo8z5v

— ANI (@ANI) July 18, 2018

Opposition doesn't have numbers but have people who will tell others how govt has be-fooled the nation. Sarkar girane layak jab number nahi hai to maksad kyun sarkar girane ka hai? Vishwas ye hai ki janta ke mann mein avishwas paida kar dein: RG Yadav, SP #NoConfidenceMotion pic.twitter.com/XBVLeuifFj

— ANI (@ANI) July 18, 2018

I think such over confidence will serve no purpose. We will show clear majority on July 20. We will win comfortably and show our strength to the opposition: Union Minister Ramdas Athawale on Sonia Gandhi's statement "Who says we don't have the numbers?" over #NoConfidence motion pic.twitter.com/3tEmewBQzT

— ANI (@ANI) July 18, 2018

Congress had shown similar kind of arrogance during Atal Ji's tenure & they had to face the consequences. Indians have elected PM Modi as their leader & he has their confidence. We are ready to face them: D Pradhan on Sonia Gandhi's statement 'who says we don't have the numbers' pic.twitter.com/LTn7G4Dt8m

— ANI (@ANI) July 18, 2018

details.title: Anandrao Adsul says topics raised by Rahul today had some base
details.content:
The topics that Rahul Gandhi had raised today, did had some base. The image that PM Modi and BJP govt have created can be damaged with such allegations: Anandrao Adsul, Shiv Sena on Rahul Gandhi's Lok Sabha speech. #NoConfidenceMotion pic.twitter.com/Xu8XLLyMAI

— ANI (@ANI) July 20, 2018
